task-wr.title: Configuring Enabled User Emulation
task-wr.shortdesc: For LDAP-backed Keystone, special steps may be required to enable users in Keystone, depending on the LDAP implementation.

context.p: CGTS-4885 new topicSome LDAP implementations, such as OpenLDAP, do not have an attribute for enabling users. You can emulate one for use with Keystone by designating an LDAP group to identify enabled users, and then populating the group. You can then set service parameters to specify the group in Keystone and enable its use.

note.p: If the LDAP implementation includes a Boolean attribute for enabling users, you can use the set_user_enabled service parameter to identify the attribute for use in Keystone. For details, see the public OpenStack documentation (The following external link would be difficult for a printed PDF user to follow.for example, Configuring an Identity Provider).
If the LDAP implementation uses an integer-based attribute for enabling users, you can configure Keystone to use the integer-based attribute. For details, see the public OpenStack documentation.

step.cmd: Enable the use of a group to emulate an enabled attribute for users.
If required, create a groupOfNames object to contain the users.

info.p: This is required for a read-only LDAP-backed Keystone configuration. The LDAP server administrator must create the object.

step.cmd: To enable users, add them to the group.

info.p: You can also disable users by removing them from the group.
